meanings.definition: To sow seed again in (a field or lawn)
meanings.sent1: After the harvest, the farmer will reseed the field for the next season.
meanings.sent2: It is important to reseed the lawn in the spring to keep it healthy and green.
meanings.sent3: The field was so happy to be reseeded, it smiled with new sprouts.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to reseed hope in his heart, growing stronger each day.
meanings.sent5: The act of reseeding the field felt like a fresh start, full of potential and growth.

meanings.definition: To plant seeds again in (a garden)
meanings.sent1: Every year, she would reseed her garden with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The gardener decided to reseed the vegetable patch to ensure a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The garden seemed to giggle as it was reseeded with love and care.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter reseeded joy in the hearts of all who heard it.
meanings.sent5: The act of reseeding the garden brought forth new life, like a symphony of growth.

meanings.definition: To scatter seed again in (a field)
meanings.sent1: The farmer needed to reseed the field after the birds had eaten most of the seeds.
meanings.sent2: It's essential to reseed the field evenly to ensure a good crop yield.
meanings.sent3: The field chuckled mischievously as it was reseeded, playing a trick on the birds.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness reseeded compassion in the hearts of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The act of reseeding the field felt like painting a canvas of growth and abundance.
